channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - thesixthaxis_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 26/10/24
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2024/10/26/something-for-the-weekend-26-10-24/

It’s the trickier of the two clock changing weekends, with time falling back by an hour overnight and in theory giving everyone an extra hour in bed. What’s actually going to happen is that a lot of kids will still wake up at the same time, and pets are going to demand feeding an hour “early” for at least the next fortnight, which is going to see an awful lot of things knocked off shelves and tables by mardy cats.

Great for childless and pet-less gamers, though, who’ve got an extra hour to spend with Black Ops 6, or whatever else tickles their fancy tomorrow.

In the News This Week

  • Monster Hunter Wilds open beta is coming next week!
  • Ubisoft has disbanded the Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown team
  • Netflix closes its AAA Team Blue studio
  • Among Ashes has been confirmed for PS5
  • Football Manager 24 will not be updated with 2024/25 season data
  • Metal Slug Tactics will be out on November 5th
  • Sniper Elite: Resistance shoots for January 2025 release date
  • State of Decay 2 gets one final update as Undead Labs focus on sequel
  • Dead Island 2 free Neighbourhood Watch horde mode & NG+ update is out now
  • Bandai Namco will publish Rebel Wolves’ RPG, Dawnwalker

Games in Review & Featured Articles

We had the highest of highs for a new VR puzzle shooter this week, and some great other options elsewhere:

  • Vendetta Forever – PSVR 2, Meta Quest 2+3 – 9/10
  • Tormenture – PC – 8/10
  • Sonic X Shadow Generations – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 8/10
  • Romance of the Three Kingdoms 8 Remake – PS5, PS4, NSW, PC – 8/10
  • Neva – PS5, XSX|S, NSW, PC – 7/10
  • Diablo IV Vessel of Hatred – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, PC – 6/10
  • Sky Oceans: Wings for Hire – PS5, XSX|S, NSW, PC – 3/10

And Dom popped a gaming headset on his noggin:

  • Turtle Beach Stealth 500 Gaming – 8/10

Elsewhere, I shared a preview of the intriguing builder, exploration, survival game Towers of Aghasba, while Jim’s forays into New World: Aeternum saw him impressed by the MMO’s relaunch and console port.

Rounding things out as always, What We Played featured New World, Phasmophobia and Tormenture.

Trailer Park

Monster Hunter Wilds gets an oily new monster trailer

Get a look at The Thing: Remastered in a new gameplay trailer

Yooka-Laylee remake confirmed for PS5, Xbox Series and “Nintendo platforms”

Atomfall trailer reveals gameplay and the post-Windscale disaster world

Your Achievements

Let’s see what you’ve been up to:

  • TSBonyman completed the first of his Sherlock games, Crimes & Punishment, and is already enjoying the improvements of its successor, The Devil’s Daughter.
  • And Andrewww’s continued to make progress to the end of Horizon Forbidden West, but is starting to feel some open world fatigue.

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead!
